result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquavis T Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for early termination of probation at any point after 6 months, if all restitution is paid and agent deems appropriate.  Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Apply 3 days sentence credit.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.

Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.  Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Weathers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
 3 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for early termination of probation at any point after 6 months, if all restitution is paid and agent deems appropriate.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Walmart listed in the criminal complaint.

RESTITUTION:  $565 (to be paid to WalMart - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea hearing on April 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
